desc: Social work majors study scientific approaches to building knowledge for generalist practice and assessing effectiveness and efficiency of both individual practice and social service programs. Students learn to assess needs and progress, design case interventions, measure client satisfaction and assess program outcomes. They evaluate elements of practice with diverse clients and portions of programs with which they are familiar and apply ethical standards to scientific inquiry. Open to family studies majors and others by permission of program director. Offered Spring Semester.
name: Eval/SW Practice/Prog
notes: This course is open to Family Studies and Social Work majors only.
title: Evaluation of Social Work Practice and Programs
